programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Dramatic Car Chases
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt – except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.sub-title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Homestead’s Hidden Treasures
programme.desc: Ed and Day learn that in Homestead, looks can be deceiving. The guys throw axes in a bank, zip line in a church, and end the day with a beer at Duke's.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Put That Sauce on Anything
programme.desc: Chef Manny Hernandez of Barrels and Boards in Raynham pushes the pace against Chef Ryan Dziki of Wild Fox Pierogi. Will the chefs be able to identify the right ingredients and replicate each other’s sauces before the clock runs out?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Sacramento: Breakfast for Dinner
programme.desc: Everybody loves a hearty breakfast for dinner, but will Chef Sean Rumery or Chef Collin Torres most impress the judges with their elevated spin on a classic? Find out on this egg-cellent episode of Plate It!

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: A Mother's Nightmare: The Desperate Search for Cupcake
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.sub-title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Tech N9ne, Chiefs Barber, & Urban Hiker Unveil Their Top Hot Spots
programme.desc: We've got Tech N9ne, the legendary artist who wrote 'KCMO Anthem,' DeJuan Bonds, the barber for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Lisa Peña, a local guide who believes KC is best viewed by foot. You don't want to miss their recommendations!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Crime Fighter in Plane Sight
programme.desc: While dedicating her time to criminal justice reform, Erinn placed connecting with nature on the back burner. She’s a free spirit who travels the world and jumps out of planes but doesn’t know what Kentucky has to offer – it's time to change that.

programme.title: Power of One
programme.desc: News 8 is following the journey of a young York County woman with a stage 4 terminal cancer diagnosis as part of our series, "Power of One".

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.sub-title: Silver Linings: Not Your Grandmother's Retirement
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion aren’t slowing down; they’re rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project
programme.desc: Join WGAL News 8's Anne Shannon for "Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project," where we relive the best of 2024 through the eyes of our award-winning photojournalists.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Impromptu Acts of Kindness Bring Joy To A Kansas Woman on Hard Times
programme.desc: Acts of kindess don't always have to be big gestures! Sometimes a favor to a stranger, or a day spent with a friend can make all the difference, as Justin and Ryan learn on the road in Kansas.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Screenprinters Pull Paint with True Grit to Honor Old West
programme.desc: It’s time to saddle up as three Oklahoma natives pull themselves to victory creating original screen print deigns encapsulating the Old West. Do these makers have the true grit it takes to be Maker Nation Champion?

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A festive headpiece in New Orleans, and wooden toy making in Omaha.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Dating Is Music To Aurora’s Ears
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.sub-title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.sub-title: News 9 True Crime: The Middle Child
programme.desc: (2022) In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Mystery of Maura Murray
programme.desc: Known as one of the first cases of the digital age, Maura Murray's mysterious disappearance continues to confound investigators and internet sleuths.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In “Free Spirit,” award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: Highway of Horrors: The Shotgun Slayer Manhunt
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.
